text:
If the Jasper logging level is set to DEBUG, the JspServlet service() method 
logs the request parameters by calling request.getParameter() for each 
parameter, without specifying any encoding (which it can't of course, not 
knowing that...)

When a JSP page wants to get a parameter afterwards by explicitely specifying 
an encoding (by means of the request.setCharacterEncoding()) method, the 
HttpRequestBase simply returns the result of the first call by Jasper and hence 
the specified encoding is ignored.

As far as I'm concerned, causing software to print debug information should 
NEVER alter its behaviour, hence I consider this to be a bug.
creator: francis.vermeulen@atosorigin.com

text:
I appreciate the problem you describe and agree with the principle that 
turning on debug shouldn't alter behaviour.

The choice here is between including the parameters in the debug output and 
causing the problem you describe or not including them and depriving  
developer of a lot of useful information.

On balance I think we should keep the existing behaviour. There are a number 
of alternative approaches you can take to set the parameter encoding that may 
help you by setting the encoding before you reach the debug statement. Have a 
look at bug 22666 for a description of these options (and other character 
encoding issues)
creator: markt@apache.org
